summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T on June 22, 2020, demanding extensive phone records for three specific phone numbers covering periods from 1999-2012. It includes a cover sheet, a letter requesting confidentiality, the subpoena itself, a rider specifying the records requested, and a declaration form for a custodian of records. The subpoena is part of an investigation into violations of federal statutes related to coercion/enticement and child exploitation.

persons.name: Acting United States Attorney
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Co-signed the grand jury subpoena and the confidentiality request letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: Designated as the point of contact for the physical production of subpoenaed documents if personal appearance is waived.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which AT&T is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested documents to the FBI.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued and sent to AT&T.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007

United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks records for three specific phone numbers, with time periods spanning from 1999 through 2012, indicating a long-term investigative focus.
The investigation is for suspected felony violations of U.S. Code sections related to coercion/enticement (18 U.S.C. § 2422) and child exploitation/abuse material (18 U.S.C. §§ 2251, 2252, 2252A).
The U.S. Attorney's Office strongly requested AT&T to keep the subpoena confidential to avoid impeding the investigation.
The requested records are extensive, including subscriber info, billing, correspondence, and call details for the specified numbers.
The document shows the investigation was active and using grand jury powers as of June 2020.
